3.inputValue: Do you have requirements for sending data from the field? Think about what network coverage exists in yoru area and the cost of SMS and data. Do you need to collect information offline, to be sent at a later time? There are many things to keep in mind when deciding between cloud hosting and a local instal. Local installs make it possible to store data onsite and access data offline, but most likely require more time and IT skills to get the software up and running. If you need a local install, does it need to be easy to install without an IT resource? Do you need to syncronize the data with data on other local instalations?

3.inputValue: Is data being collected as part of a one time survey? If so, no case management is needed. Do you need to track information collected from many forms at different times, all related to the same subject (such as a patient, or a health center)? If so, do you need the system to manage the subject identification for you, or provide a limited profile on a subject? If so, chose "some." If you need more advance case management, such as a full patient profile, or the ability to update a patient's profile from the field, select "advanced."
